About Me

Hi, my name’s Bharatraj, and I’m a computer engineering major at Michigan State University. I’m a member of MSU’s Formula SAE team, where I apply my skills in circuit design and system integration. Alongside hardware projects, I also have experience in basic web development.

I am most skilled in: Altium

Projects

Nrshmnt.ai

https://devpost.com/software/nrshmnt-ai

A recipe generator that creates balanced meals tailored to your exact protein, fat, and carbohydrate needs.

I built this website to simplify the process of cooking while tracking macros, which can often be time-consuming and tedious. By entering your target calories, protein, and food preferences, the app uses the ChatGPT 3.5 API to generate seven recipes in parallel and selects the one that best matches your input—removing the hassle of calculating portions and finding ingredients so you can get straight to cooking.

Experience

Michigan State Formula SAE

Electrical System Member

October 2024 - Present

https://www.msuformularacing.com/

Designing and testing custom electronics for high-voltage systems in an open-wheel electric race car.

As a member of the electronics subgroup, I worked on PCB design using Altium, developed circuit models for various subsystems, and built load bank models to support accumulator testing. My role focuses on the design, modeling, and validation of low- and high-voltage electrical components critical to vehicle performance and safety.

Michigan State Rocketry

Electrical System Member - XBee remote communications

September 2024 - June 2025

https://msurocketry.org/

Integrating embedded systems and RF communication to support telemetry and ground-station interfacing.

Developed a telemetry system using XBee modules to wirelessly transmit flight data from the rocket to a ground station. Used minicom on a Raspberry Pi to remotely interface with the ground-side XBee, enabling real-time data reception and monitoring during launch operations.

iCode Novi

Assistant Director

June 2023 - September 2024

https://icodeschool.com/

Empowering the next generation through hands-on tech education and leadership in STEM learning environments.

Guided instructors at the top-performing iCode franchise nationwide, supported course and camp sales, developed teaching frameworks, and assisted with promotional materials. Taught over 100 students and collaborated with dozens of instructors across various subjects, including game development with Unreal Engine 5 and Roblox Studio, robotics with VEX IQ, and web development using CSS, HTML, JavaScript, and PHP. Represented iCode at conventions such as ASEICON and optimized curriculum delivery for in-house technology.

Education

Michigan State University

Bachelor of Science, Computer Engineering

2023 - Present · GPA: 4.0

Founded in 1855, Michigan State University is a top-tier public research university recognized for its excellence in engineering, innovation, and interdisciplinary learning.

As a Computer Engineering student at Michigan State University, I’ve built a strong foundation in both hardware and software systems through coursework in Circuits and Systems I & II, Electric Circuits Laboratory, and Introduction to Programming II (CSE232). I’ve applied these skills through hands-on involvement in the Formula SAE and Rocketry teams, contributing to real-world electronics, PCB design, and embedded telemetry systems.
